properties.name: ApiKey
properties.description: A unique alphanumeric identiﬁer used to authenticate a user, developer, or calling program to your API.

properties.description: The code provided by the connector when it has been authenticated via the connected app.

properties.name: RedirectUri
properties.description:

granted.

The URL to which the authentication server redirects the browser after authorization has been
granted.

properties.name: ApplicationKey
properties.description: Application keys, in conjunction with your API key, give you full access to Datadog’s programmatic API. Application keys are associated with the user account that created them. The application key is used to log all requests made to the API.

type.description: Application keys, in conjunction with your API key, give you full access to Datadog’s programmatic API. Application keys are associated with the user account that created them. The application key is used to log all requests made to the API.

properties.description: The object key for the destination bucket in which Amazon AppFlow will place the ﬁles.

properties.name: ClusterIdentifier
properties.description: The unique identifier of the Amazon Redshift cluster.

type.description: The unique identifier of the Amazon Redshift cluster.

properties.name: DataApiRoleArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants Amazon AppFlow access to the data through the Amazon Redshift Data API.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants Amazon AppFlow access to the data through the Amazon Redshift Data API.

properties.name: DatabaseName
properties.description: The name of the Amazon Redshift database that will store the transferred data.

type.description: The name of the Amazon Redshift database that will store the transferred data.

properties.name: DatabaseUrl
properties.description: The JDBC URL of the Amazon Redshift cluster.

type.description: The JDBC URL of the Amazon Redshift cluster.

properties.name: IsRedshiftServerless
properties.description: If Amazon AppFlow will connect to Amazon Redshift Serverless or Amazon Redshift cluster.

type.description: If Amazon AppFlow will connect to Amazon Redshift Serverless or Amazon Redshift cluster.

properties.name: RoleArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.

properties.name: WorkgroupName
properties.description: The name of the Amazon Redshift serverless workgroup

type.description: The name of the Amazon Redshift serverless workgroup

properties.name: DisableSSO
properties.description: If you set this parameter to true, Amazon AppFlow bypasses the single sign-on (SSO) settings in your SAP account when it accesses your SAP OData instance.

type.description: If you set this parameter to true, Amazon AppFlow bypasses the single sign-on (SSO) settings in your SAP account when it accesses your SAP OData instance.
